business.headline: LIC Mutual Fund reduces daily minimum SIP limit to Rs 100Investors can now begin a SIP with just Rs 100 and in multiples of Re 1 thereafter for select schemes of LIC Mutual Fund (LIC MF).

Hyundai IPO: Should you buy shares after its listing?While the buzz surrounding the IPO is palpable, many brokerages are urging investors to take a cautious approach. They advise looking at Hyundai's long-term growth potential rather than getting caught up in the excitement of quick listing gains.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as metal and auto stocks pull markets downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 152.93 points to close at 81,820.12, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.85 points to end at 25,066.15.

Hyundai IPO: Why investors should focus on long-term growth, not listing gainsHyundai Motor IPO: While Hyundai's IPO is undoubtedly generating excitement, experts are saying this is more of a marathon than a sprint.

Hyundai IPO: Check latest subscription and GMP on Day 1Hyundai Motor India IPO: India's biggest public offering opened for subscription on Monday, looking to raise Rs 27,870.16 crore with an offer for sale of 14.22 crore shares.

RIL shares dip 1% after Q2 results. What should investors do? Reliance Industries share price: The dip, driven by weaker-than-expected performance in its oil-to-chemicals (O2C) segment, has left investors and analysts contemplating their next move.

Hyundai IPO opens for subscription: Check GMP, price band, other key detailsHyundai Motor India IPO: The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share. Through this public offering, Hyundai aims to raise Rs 27,856 crore

Blinkit scraps 'zero notice' policy amid talent war in quick commerce: ReportThe change in policy comes in response to growing competition in the quick commerce industry as Blinkit faces stiff competition from other players like Zepto, Flipkart, and Swiggy.

Garuda Construction and Engineering listing: Book profit or hold?Garuda Construction and Engineering listing: Despite a sluggish outlook in the grey market, which had indicated a flat or negative listing, the company surprised many with its strong opening.

Garuda Construction and Engineering shares list at 10.5% premium at Rs 105Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO listing: The company's market debut has exceeded expectations, particularly given the flat to negative outlook in the grey market before the listing.

Nvidia inches closer to overtaking Apple as world's most valuable companyNvidia share price: The latest stock jump pushed Nvidia's market value to $3.39 trillion, just shy of Apple's $3.52 trillion, but ahead of Microsoft's $3.12 trillion.
Sensex, Nifty gain in early trade, RIL shares drop after Q2 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 194.75 points at 82,167.80 at around 9:39 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 38.30 points to 25,166.25.

RIL Q2 profit slips 5% to Rs 16,563 crore, still beats market expectationsRIL Q2 results: Reliance Industries beat street expectations in Q2 despite a 5% drop in profit, driven by strong digital and upstream growth.

HCLTech Q2 results: Net profit jumps 11% to Rs 4,235 crore, dividend declaredHCLTech declared another interim dividend of Rs 12 per share, taking the total interim dividend for the fiscal year so far to Rs 42 per share.

Retail inflation jumps to 9-month high of 5.49% in SeptemberFood prices saw an even more significant spike, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) recording a year-on-year inflation rate of 9.24%. Rural areas faced food inflation of 9.08%, while urban areas experienced an increase of 9.56%.

Hyundai Motor IPO opens tomorrow: Check latest GMP, brokerage reviews and moreHyundai Motor India IPO: Priced between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share, the IPO is expected to raise Rs 27,856 crore through an offer for sale of 14.2 crore shares, representing a 17.5% stake.

Sensex ends 600 points higher, Nifty gains; Wipro, HDFC Bank stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 591.69 points to 81,973.05 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 163.70 points to settle at 25, 127.95.

Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, James A. Robinson awarded Nobel Economics Prize 2024Nobel Economics Prize 2024: This year's laureates provide valuable insights into how institutions are formed and their crucial role in fostering sustainable development and prosperity.

DA hike before Diwali? Big update for central government employeesDearness Allowance (DA) is revised twice a year, providing employees with financial support that helps maintain their purchasing power as living costs rise.

Gold, silver price today, October 14, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 14, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Delhi-Chicago Air India flight diverted to Canada following bomb threatAn Air India flight travelling from Delhi to Chicago was diverted to Canada's Iqaluit airport following a bomb threat.

Maharashtra, Jharkhand Assembly election dates out, result on November 23While Maharashtra will go to polls in a single phase on November 20, Jharkhand will vote in two phases on November 13 and 20. The results will be declared on November 23.

EVM battery like that of a calculator: Poll body junks Congress's chargeThe Election Commission's clarification came after the Congress pointed out varying EVM battery levels across different polling stations in Haryana.

Bengaluru schools shut tomorrow amid heavy rain, work from home advised for officesSchools and anganwadi centres in Bengaluru will remain shut on Wednesday amid heavy rain. Besides, private companies have been advised to ask employees to work from home.

Will the India-Canada diplomatic standoff affect visa services?India-Canada row: The downturn in the already frosty ties between India and Canada may have a bearing on how visa processes are handled, potentially affecting students.

Huge distortion, need for self-introspection: Election Commission on exit pollsAfter announcing the election dates in Maharashtra and Jharkhand, Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar cautioned the media, especially electronic media, about the practice of exit polls and showing early trends on the result day.

SCO Summit in Pakistan: S Jaishankar arrives in Islamabad to attend meet LIVE UPDATESExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar landed in Pakistan today to attend the two-day SCO meet. It's the first time in nearly nine years that an Indian foreign minister has visited Pakistan.

India, Canada discussed Bishnoi gang at secret meet, claims US reportIn the meeting, Ajit Doval acknowledged that Lawrence Bishnoi was capable of orchestrating violence from wherever he was incarcerated, according to a report in The Washington Post.

Why blackbucks are so dear to Bishnoi communityThe 1998 killing of two blackbucks continues to haunt actor Salman Khan. Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi has repeatedly threatened to kill him over the incident. While the gangster could be using the case as a ruse, the Bishnois have shared a deep bond with blackbucks and chinkaras for centuries.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Trudeau twirl - Can Harris, Trump dance to India-Canada tango?With Justin Trudeau now claiming India is running covert operations on Canadian soil, it's got all the elements of a drama nobody saw coming — especially not Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

Chennai rain alert: Heavy showers hit city, 5 flights cancelled, schools shut  Live UpdatesTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has asked the information technology (IT) companies to allow their employees to work from home till October 18, amid a heavy rain alert.
Bypolls in 50 Assembly, Lok Sabha seats in November, Wayanad votes on 13thThe counting of votes for the bypolls will be held on November 23, along with Maharashtra and Jharkhand.

Maharashtra announces Diwali bonus for government staff minutes before poll datesThe Maharashtra government announced a Diwali Bonus of Rs 28,000 for all the employees of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

India, US sign Rs 32,000-crore deal for 31 Predator dronesThe development comes less than a month after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden held talks about the acquisition of the Predator drones on the sidelines of the Quad Leaders' Summit held in Delaware.

Two state funerals and one lousy equation: Baba Siddique = Ratan TataTwo state funerals in Maharashtra show a stark contrast. On October 10, the state of Maharashtra accorded a state funeral to business titan, Ratan Tata, who put the nation first in all business ventures. Three days later, another funeral was given to three-time former MLA, Baba Siddique, whose biggest achievement was uniting the Khans. Questions are being asked why the two men have been given the same honours.

Canada throws in 'Bishnoi gang' to push old charge against IndiaCanada alleged that Indian agents present on its soil are working with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang to target pro-Khalistan elements. Incidentally, the allegations come at a time when Lawrence Bishnoi is in the news in India for his alleged involvement in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique.

Brawl between NDA, Opposition MPs during Waqf bill panel meetingThe Opposition accused the BJP MPs of using offensive language against them and walked out of the meeting for the second consecutive day.

How Trudeau turned Canada into naya Pakistan for IndiaAs India recalls its envoy from Ottawa and expels diplomats, it has demoted Canada to Pakistan's status. This is how Canada has been harbouring terrorists, resorting to the blame game to become the naya Pakistan.

Video of man attending client meeting at Durga Puja pandal leaves Internet furiousA video of a man attending a client meeting while offering prayers at a Durga Puja pandal in Bengaluru has left social media users furious.

Fourth accused arrested in UP in Baba Siddique murder caseA fourth accused in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique was arrested by the Mumbai Police in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich. One individual was also detained in connection with the case.

Blackbuck case: BJP leader urges Salman Khan to apologise to Bishnoi communityBJP leader Harnath Singh Yadav called on actor Salman Khan to apologise for allegedly killing blackbucks in 1998, a case that caused outrage in the Bishnoi community and led to threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang.

Watch: Joe Root shines ball with Jack Leach's 'shiny' head in MultanJoe Root was spotted shining the red ball with Jack Leach's bald yet shiny head during the 2nd Test between England and Pakistan. The use of saliva to shine the ball was banned during Covid-19.

Varun Dhawan says Aditya Chopra denied him action film due to budget issuesBollywood star Varun Dhawan shared his experience of being turned down for an action film by filmmaker Aditya Chopra due to financial limitations.
Pics: Inside Pooja Hegde's birthday vacation to SrilankaActor Pooja Hegde recently rang in her birthday in Srilanka. She shared photos from the same on her social media handle.

Ajay Devgn calls wife Kajol 'ghar ka Singham' after her 'asli Singham' jibe Ajay Devgn hilariously answered a fan asking him about the 'real Singham at home' during his #AskAjay session on Tuesday, ahead of Singham Again release.

Fauji 2: SRK's iconic series to return with Vicky Jain, Gauahar Khan in leadShah Rukh Khan's iconic series Fauji is set to make a comeback with a second part. Created by Sandeep Singh, it will star Gauahar Khan and Vicky Jain in the lead.
Asus ProArt PX13 review: One of the best laptops in the market for creatorsAsus ProArt PX13 is a well-rounded option for creators who need power, precision, and a display that makes their work shine.

iQOO 13 likely to launch in first week of December On December 5, iQOO is launching its flagship smartphone, iQOO 13, in India to compete fiercely with the OnePlus 13, both featuring Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 series chipset.

OnePlus 13 will be slightly more expensive than OnePlus 12, new leak reveals The upcoming OnePlus 13 is set to be pricier than its predecessor, raising eyebrows over whether the hike is justified amid rumours of strategic price leaks.

Infinix Zero Flip price leaked ahead of launch on October 17Infinix Zero Flip, launching on October 17, is expected to launch below Rs 50,000. The upcoming device is the first clamshell smartphone by the company.

sports.headline: PAK vs ENG: R Ashwin in awe of Kamran Ghulam's century amid Babar Azam stormIndia all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin hailed Pakistan Test debutant Kamran Ghulam for his spectacular century during the second Test against England in Multan.

Kamran Ghulam becomes Pakistan's 2nd oldest man to hit Test hundred on debut Kamran Ghulam, 29, became the second oldest man after Abid Ali in 2019 to hit a century for Pakistan in his Test debut. India will host New Zealand for a three-match Test series, starting October 16.

Bangladesh suspend coach Chandika Hathurusingha for assaulting playerThe Bangladesh Cricket Board has suspended head coach Chandika Hathurusinghe for assaulting a player.  The development comes after Bangladesh's disappointing tour of India.

Tom Latham calls Williamson's absence 'disappointing' for Bengaluru TestNew Zealand captain Tom Latham faces a daunting challenge as Kane Williamson is ruled out of the first Test against India. Latham must lead his team without their experienced batter against an in-form Indian side.

Shubman Gill in doubt for Bengaluru Test due to stiff neckIndia vs New Zealand: Shubman Gill complained of pain in his neck and shoulders on Monday. A call on his availability will be taken on Wednesday morning before the toss, sources have said.

Rohit hailed the pacer for his experience and said that Bumrah has always been part of the leadership group.

Tamil Nadu has best infrastructure: Unadkat hails drainage during Ranji matchSaurashtra captain Jaydev Unadkat hailed the drainage facilities of the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association. The ground was completely dried up despite a day off full of rain before that.

India will not take 'undercooked' Mohammed Shami to Australia: Rohit SharmaIndia will not carry an injured Mohammed Shami to Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, said Rohit Sharma. Shami has been rehabilitating at the National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru since his ankle surgery.

Stranded for 16 hours at airport, frustrated Nigeria pull out of match vs LibyaNigeria have pulled out of their Africa Cup of Nations qualifier in Libya and were heading home after being stranded for 16 hours at an airport, 250 kilometres away from the venue. Nigeria players made the incident public via their social media accounts.

Unmukt Chand meets Sachin Tendulkar in the USA: God in Dallas todayUnmukt Chand met Sachin Tendulkar at Dallas in the USA and shared the snippets on social media. Unmukt has been participating in the USA leagues after his retirement from Indian cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
